comments:
After installing the latest dev build Eclipse got caught in a deadlock on startup:

Did this cause any bad behavior?  E.g. missing tasks in the Task List?  We're moving to M5 today so I'll probably wait to see if you can replicate with that before doing anything.
Eclipse did not respond anymore and did not repaint the workbench correctly. I can try M5 tomorrow.

I could reproduce the error with the latest integration build (I20070206-0010) and Mylar dev snapshot. This time I was more patient and the workspace was usable after 30 seconds. I get 5 exceptions of similar to the one above but the task list seems to have loaded completely.

I restarted Eclipse 3 times and the error did not reoccur. Maybe this is related to the conversion of the offline task repository that is only done on first startup: "Could not restore offline repository tasks file, creating new one, likely cause is format update."

That offline file recreation should have only happened once, so the fact that you saw this multiple times makes me think that it was not the culprit.  I still have no ideas about what could have caused this beyond a problem with Eclipse's configuration data, and startup has changed in M5.  So I'll resolve for now, but if you ever see this again please do reopen because we have to make sure there is no such problem with 2.0M1.
